title: Piers Morgan blasts 'snivelling' rival Dan Walker over Meghan Markle
text:
Piers Morgan and Dan Walker have publicly clashed over Meghan Markle, the Duchess of Sussex (Pictures: BBC/REX/GETTY)

Piers Morgan and his daytime TV rival Dan Walker have clashed again, this time over Meghan Markle the Duchess of Sussex.

It comes after ITV aired a documentary about their visit to Africa, in which the duchess admitted how she was struggling with the media attention since becoming a mum.

The Good Morning Britain presenter, who has been very vocal about his feelings about Meghan in the past, accused her and husband Prince Harry of their trip ‘all about their own terrible struggles’.

He tweeted: ‘Imagine being two staggeringly privileged royal multi-millionaires going to Africa to make a documentary that supposedly “shines a light” on poverty, violence against women/girls & racial inequality – then in fact making it all about their own terrible struggle? I mean, FFS.’

Dan fired back, retweeting his comment and calling Piers out for ‘picking on’ the duchess.

‘Imagine being given a TV show & a newspaper column & using them both to pick on a woman who didn’t want to go out for a second drink with you,’ he said.

Piers, who has repeatedly accused Meghan of ghosting him, clarified the situation with a string of putdowns: ‘Imagine being the dullest, most excruciatingly virtue-signalling, tediously opinion-devoid, toe-curlingly snivelling sycophant on TV?

‘Ps For the record, I never asked Meghan for a drink, she asked me.’

Not wanting to leave it there, the BBC Breakfast host shot back: ‘Imagine losing the plot (and the argument) to the “dullest, most excruciatingly virtue-signalling, tediously opinion-devoid, toe-curlingly snivelling sycophant on TV”‘ adding a thumbs up and cry-laughing face emojis, along with the jokey hashtag #TearsForPiers.

‘Mate, the only thing I lose when jousting with you is the will to live,’ Piers said.

As ever, Piers’ co-host Susanna Reid calmly stepped in with the point that everything highlighted in the programme was worth hearing about.

She said: ‘Most of it was about the charity work they do. Hugely important. It was also an insight into their personal state of mind. Also important.’

Meghan Markle has spoken about how tough it is being a new mum in the spotlight (Picture: Getty)

Earlier this year Piers has congratulated Meghan on being a ‘top social climber’, accused her of behaving ‘like a Kardashian’, and advised her to ‘go back to America’ if she wants privacy.
